title: SoftBank Reports $13 Billion Annual Loss, Hit by Tech-Share Slump
sub_head: Japanese technology investor sees worst result in its four-decade history
body:
TOKYO—Japanese technology investor SoftBank Group Corp. on Thursday reported the biggest annual loss in its four-decade history because of the global selloff in technology shares.
SoftBank, known for its $100 billion Vision Fund, reported a net loss of ¥1.71 trillion, equivalent to $13.2 billion, for the year that ended March 31. That was its biggest full-year loss, topping a record set two years ago, and followed a nearly ¥5 trillion net profit the previous fiscal year.
